meanings.definition: The act of publishing something again.
meanings.sent1: The republication of the classic novel brought joy to many readers.
meanings.sent2: The republication of the newspaper article sparked a lot of discussion.
meanings.sent3: The republication of the recipe book made everyone hungry again.
meanings.sent4: The republication of the old photograph brought back memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The republication of the research paper helped students understand the topic better.

meanings.definition: The act of making something available to the public again.
meanings.sent1: The online republication of the music album made it accessible to more listeners.
meanings.sent2: The republication of the out-of-print book made it easier for people to find and read.
meanings.sent3: The republication of the movie online led to a surge in viewership.
meanings.sent4: The republication of the art exhibition attracted a new wave of visitors.
meanings.sent5: The republication of the public notice ensured everyone was informed about the event.

meanings.definition: The act of distributing something again.
meanings.sent1: The republication of the flyers increased awareness about the event.
meanings.sent2: The republication of the brochures helped reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: The republication of the coupons led to a frenzy of shopping.
meanings.sent4: The republication of the leaflets brought in more customers to the store.
meanings.sent5: The republication of the pamphlets ensured that the information reached more people.
